page.title: 10FARMING IN THE KEMPSEY AREA.
page.content: Mr. Kite of Kites Farm is a dairy farmer at Stonehall near Norton.He owns 90 acres of land and 90 cows.He rents his farm from the Hereford and Worcester County Council.It is not a generational farm. He has rented the reasonably small farm for over 13 years. He is affected by the EEC agricultural policy in that he is told how much milk to produce and at what cost. Mr Kite sells his milk (which is unpasteurized) to the milk marketing board only for 6 pence a pint (the current price of milk in the shops is 21 pence). Mr Kite thinks that this is unfair as he has the cost of both buying and feeding the cows as well as the upkeep of the land in general. Another problem for Mr Kite is the theft of machinery from his farm and damage to property by vandals.
